page.title: 01GENERAL AREA OF HUNDLETON
page.content: Hundleton is a small village at the meeting point of five roads and lanes. It is situated at the north-east corner of the area which stretches 4 km to the west and 3 km to the south of it. The village is on top of a ridge which runs downhill to the south-west to a stream before rising again into the extreme south-west corner of the area. The main route across the area runs from Pembroke in the east to Angle in the west. It goes south-west first, to a junction at which stands a public house - 'The Speculation' - then west to Angle, whilst a minor road continues south-west to the hamlet of Castlemartin. Other roads connect Hundleton to Bentlass on the Pembroke River, Orielton Field Centre and local farms.
